page.title: 10Religion in The Shelsleys
page.content: There are two churches,{All Saints {Shelsley Beauchamp}and{St. Andrew's {Shelsley Walsh.}The population are mainly{Church of England.}There are three{Roman Catholic}families and one family are members of{The Society of {Friends.}The average attendance on Sundays is 22.3 and at festivals 45.7. The congregation at both churches is made up of the same people, and adhere mostly to the{1662 Prayer Book.}There is a choir of women and children which sings in both churches. There is a small Bible Study group which meets regularly in members' houses. The people who live on Martley Hillside belong to the parish of Martley. { Christmas}is observed by several special services - Midnight Communion and services of lessons and carols. At {Harvest}time the church is decorated with flowers, fruit and vegetables.
